intro: Parasenegalia muricata, commonly known as the spiny palaquio, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
